title: What are the subjects required for bba? - Quora

response.answer_text: BBA SUBJECTS BBA course is a base for the management education which would be effective if there are plans for taking higher education programs like MBA, PGDM etc. The duration of the course varies from university to university, also the course is known by various names like Bachelor of Business Studies [BBS] and Bachelor of Business Management Studies [BMS]. BBA course correspondence can be taken up either as Full-time course or Part-time course. The BBA course duration is for 3 years divided into 6 semesters with following BBA course subjects tabulated below. The BBA course subjects basically concentrate on business and management skills .i.e. subjects in BBA are the subjects that help in building the skills required for accomplishing business BBA Subjects -1st Semester · Human Resource Management -I · Principles of Management-I · Financial Accounting · Quantitative Methods- I · Computer Applications BBA Subjects -2nd Semester · Effective Communication- I · Managerial Economics-I · Business Law-I · Principles of Management-II · Management Accounting-I BBA Subjects – 3rd Semester · Business Law- II · Management Accounting –II · Business Environment · Family Business Management · Project Work BBA Subjects – 4th Semester · Quantitative Methods in Business- II · Managerial Economics- II · Financial Management-I · Effective Communication- II · Human Resource Management- II BBA Subjects – 5th Semester · Operations Management · Marketing Management · Direct Taxes · Indirect Taxes · Research Methodology in Management BBA Subjects – 6th Semester · Environment Management · International Marketing · Export/Import Management · Public Relations Management · Project Management

In today’s competitive world, students aim at building their career right after class 12 th , and with the declaration of board results, students get busy in choosing their career prospects. Gone are the days when students had limited course options – today, there are numerous new avenues for students after 12 th . Top 10 BBA colleges in India One of the most popular choices for a successful career is Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA). Students have the choice of pursuing the course from a government or a private college. Usually, BBA programs are structured in such a way that the students learnt the basic management skills right from the start. Also, students are taught the art of effective communication. However, there are some institutes that provide the students an opportunity to specialise in certain areas. Usually, these specialisations are offered in the final year – this is where the students get a little confused. Difference between BBA followed by MBA vs Integrated (BBA+MBA) degree We bring to you a list of the top specializations offered in BBA. Knowing about the specialisations can help you make a better choice. 1) BBA in Banking and Insurance What is it about? Bachelor of Business Administration in Banking and Insurance makes a student aware of the concepts and fundamentals used in banking and insurance sectors. The degree course focuses on the basic management concepts and provides specialised training in the following subjects: International banking and insuranceRisk managementInvestment bankingTreasury operationsProject and InfrastructureBenefits of the course Students get a basic understanding of the insurance and financial marketsBetter insurance and financial services are provided by the students as they are exposed to global competitionHigh placement chancesThe degree course helps in creating efficient insurance and financial plannersStudents can serve as a lecturer/teacher in colleges or universities as the course will provide them an in depth knowledge of the specializationJobs Available in BBA Banking & Insurance Investment banker Insurance manager Administrative officer Agent & broker Assistant controller Loan counsellor Credit & risk manager Investment analyst Asset manager Customer service representative Internal auditor Personal financial advisor Loss control specialist Loan officer Recovery agent Stock analyst Treasurer 5 reasons why you should opt for BBA / BBS degree 2) BBA Finance What is it about? This undergraduate course prepares students in making predictions and forecasts about investments and insurance. The course is designed in such a manner that the students gain theoretical as well as practical knowledge of financial components like: InvestmentsPortfolio managementFinancial engineeringInternational financeCorporate financeBenefits of the course Attaining managerial/leadership roles is easy as students gain an in depth knowledge in banking & financeNumerous jobs opportunities are availableThe students acquire a professional qualification in bankingIf willing to opt for research studies, students can enroll in a Master’s degree followed by researchJobs Available in BBA Finance Financial manager Assistance controller Credit analyst Financial analyst consultant Business analyst Internal auditor Financial investment analyst Loan counsellor Loan officer Marketing & sales executive Finance officer Finance executive Management analyst Personal financial advisor Tax assistant Research analyst Treasurer Recovery agent 10 Perfect Resume Tips for BBA students 1) BBA Human Resource What is it about? Bachelor of Business Administration in Human Resource Management is one of the most popular courses. The course is a combination of general management techniques and expert training in Personnel Management/ Human Resources. Benefits of the course High possibility of establishing a successful career in HR departments of well-known companiesThe course content is always updated – this keeps the students well-informed about the current market trendsThe HR department is one of the most looked-highly upon departments as it plays a vital role in creating the corporate policies of a companyJobs Available in BBA HR HR executive Personnel manager HR manager Admin executive PR manager HR consultant IT Recruiter Recruitment consultant Trainee Human Resource Management Product Development executive Purchase/Vendor Development manager Sales/Business development manager Production manager Regional manager Quality assurance/ Quality control manager 6 tips to nail BBA entrance test 4) BBA Information Technology What is it about? Bachelor of Business Administration in Information Technology is a combined study of the fundamentals and functional areas of Information Technology and Management. Under this course, students can expect to be aware of the emerging IT trends. The degree program covers IT syllabus in: Computer ScienceInformation Database ManagementNetworking Information TechnologyInformation Management TheoryRelated technology applicationsBenefits of the course Fastest growing career opportunityAttractive pay packages and lucrative job profilesDuring the course, the student gains training in latest technologies and is exposed to best practices in a businessJobs Available in BBA IT Application Programmer Information Systems Manager Computer Information Specialist Business Intelligence Manager Enterprise Information Officer Information Security Coordinator Graphic designer Information Architect Hardware and Network expert Information Technologist Web designer Maintenance technician Know the syllabus of BBA entrance exam 5) BBA Marketing What is it about? Bachelor of Business Administration in Marketing is yet another popular course among the students wherein, they study about: Market research and analysisPricingProduct designSelling and distributionPromotionAdvertisingOther marketing conceptsBenefits of the course Marketing is a crucial business activity – due to this, there is provision of numerous job opportunitiesRewarding careerDecent pay packagesNumerous job profilesJobs Available in BBA Marketing Marketing executive Brand manager Product manager Marketing manager Advertising manager Marketing communications manager Sales manager Market research analyst 6) BBA Foreign Trade What is it about? This undergraduate business management course teaches students about foreign trade or international trade. Here, students gain knowledge about exchange of goods, capitals and services. The subjects taught are: Principals of business managementMathematics and statisticsEconomicsIndustrial relationsMarketing managementForeign trade policyFinancial managementBenefits of the course Students can try out their hand at various jobs related to commerce, banking, trade, accounting etc. Leadership/managerial roles in the business sector can be acquired easily as the course provides a solid base in the field Jobs Available in BBA Foreign Trade Sales & Marketing manager Finance manager Brand manager Market research executive Business development manager Retail manager International business manager Export manager Supply-chain manager Material manager Know which specialization suits your requirement, and make the right choice.
